Docs.remarks:
File based data objects operate on streams. Only a small amount of data is stored in core at any time, so the size of the data objects is not limited by GPGME.
The current .NET implementation of the GpgmeFileData class is inherited from the class. All data that will be read from - or written to the file stream needs to be passed from managed to unmanaged memory and vice versa. A more efficient implementation that directly passes a C file descriptor or stream to GPGME is planned for future releases.
